author: Ben Raby
title: Ovechkin returns to Capitals practice
text:
Ovechkin returns to Capitals practice By Ben Raby October 14, 2015 12:05 pm Washington Capitals left wing Alex Ovechkin (8), of Russia, skates with the puck during the third period of an NHL preseason hockey game against the Carolina Hurricanes, Monday, Sept. 21, 2015, in Washington. The Capitals won 2-0. (AP Photo/Nick Wass) 
ARLINGTON, Va. — Capitals captain Alex Ovechkin returned to practice Wednesday after missing Tuesday’s game for personal reasons. The Capitals fell 5-0 to the San Jose Sharks in their most lopsided defeat at home since a 5-0 loss to the Dallas Stars on April 1, 2014. 
Jason Chimera was absent from practice Wednesday and is considered day-to-day with a lower-body injury. Chimera fell awkwardly into the Sharks’ net midway through the third period and appeared to be favoring his left leg as he skated back to the bench. Chimera took a regular shift after the incident and led the Capitals with six shots on goal. 
Both Ovechkin and Chimera had a goal and an assist in Washington’s 5-3 win against New Jersey in the season opener last Saturday. 
The Capitals (1-1-0) continue their season-opening, four-game homestand on Thursday as they face the defending Stanley Cup Champion Chicago Blackhawks. The Blackhawks will be playing their second game in as many nights following their matchup with the Philadelphia Flyers Wednesday. Topics:
